skill.name: molfeat
skill.description: Molecular featurization for ML (100+ featurizers). ECFP, MACCS, descriptors, pretrained models (ChemBERTa), convert SMILES to features, for QSAR and molecular ML.
skill.summary: Molecular featurization for ML (100+ featurizers). ECFP, MACCS, descriptors, pretrained models (Chem...
skill.author: K-Dense-AI

security_audit.summary: The molfeat skill is a legitimate cheminformatics library for molecular feature extraction. All 397 static findings are false positives triggered by scientific terminology in documentation. The scanner misinterpreted markdown code fences as shell commands, chemistry terminology (ecfp, maccs, gin, c2) as security threats, and documentation URLs as network indicators.

content.value_statement: Molecular machine learning requires converting chemical structures into numerical representations. Molfeat provides 100+ featurizers to transform SMILES strings into machine learning-ready features for QSAR modeling and drug discovery.
actual_capabilities: Convert SMILES strings to 100+ types of molecular features
Generate ECFP, MACCS, and other molecular fingerprints
Extract molecular descriptors using RDKit and Mordred
Use pretrained models like ChemBERTa for deep embeddings
Process molecules in parallel with automatic batching
Save and load featurizer configurations for reproducibility
limitations: Requires valid SMILES strings or RDKit molecule objects
Some pretrained models need additional dependencies
Large datasets may require chunking for memory efficiency
Deep learning models are slower than fingerprint methods

use_cases.title: Build QSAR models for drug properties
use_cases.description: Use molecular fingerprints and descriptors to train machine learning models predicting ADME properties, toxicity, or bioactivity

use_cases.title: Virtual screening of compound libraries
use_cases.description: Convert millions of molecules to features for similarity searching and activity prediction against biological targets

use_cases.title: Chemical space analysis and clustering
use_cases.description: Generate molecular embeddings to visualize and cluster chemical libraries for diversity analysis

prompt_templates.title: Basic fingerprint generation
prompt_templates.prompt: Use molfeat to convert these SMILES to ECFP fingerprints: CCO, CC(=O)O, c1ccccc1. Show the code and output shape.

prompt_templates.title: Batch processing descriptors
prompt_templates.scenario: Extract molecular descriptors for a dataset
prompt_templates.prompt: Load a dataset of 100 molecules and extract RDKit 2D descriptors using molfeat with parallel processing.

prompt_templates.title: Pretrained model embeddings
prompt_templates.prompt: Use ChemBERTa to generate embeddings for drug-like molecules and visualize them with PCA.

prompt_templates.title: QSAR pipeline optimization
prompt_templates.prompt: Compare ECFP, MACCS, and ChemBERTa features for predicting molecular properties using random forest regression.

output: Generated ECFP fingerprint with radius 3 and 2048 bits

output_examples.input: Compare ECFP, MACCS, and RDKit descriptors for caffeine
output: MACCS: 167-bit structural keys with 28 true bits
RDKit2D: 200+ descriptor values including LogP=0.43, TPSA=61.1

best_practices: Use n_jobs=-1 for parallel processing on multi-core systems
Cache pretrained model embeddings to avoid recomputation
Handle invalid molecules with ignore_errors=True for large datasets
anti_patterns: Processing one molecule at a time in loops instead of batch processing
Using deep learning models for simple similarity searches where fingerprints suffice
Ignoring error handling when processing large compound libraries

faq.question: What is the difference between calculators and transformers?
faq.answer: Calculators process single molecules while transformers handle batches with parallelization and scikit-learn compatibility.

faq.question: Which featurizer should I use for QSAR modeling?
faq.answer: Start with ECFP fingerprints (radius 2-3, 1024-2048 bits) as they capture molecular connectivity patterns relevant to bioactivity.

faq.question: How do I handle invalid SMILES strings?
faq.answer: Set ignore_errors=True in MoleculeTransformer to skip invalid molecules and continue processing.

faq.question: Can I combine multiple featurizers?
faq.answer: Yes, use FeatConcat to combine different feature types like fingerprints and descriptors into a single vector.

faq.question: Why are pretrained models slower than fingerprints?
faq.answer: Deep learning models require neural network inference while fingerprints use predefined algorithms, but offer better transfer learning capabilities.

faq.question: How do I save and reuse featurizer configurations?
faq.answer: Use transformer.to_state_yaml_file() to save and MoleculeTransformer.from_state_yaml_file() to reload configurations.
